field.name: If the mother is concerned about her baby not getting enough milk, then:
Encourage mother and build her confidence by reviewing how to attach and position the baby to her breast
Reassure her that her baby is getting enough milk when her baby is:
Not visibly thin (or is getting fatter/putting on weight if he or she was thin earlier)
Gaining weight (refer to the babyâ€™s health card). IF you are not sure weight gain is appropriate, then refer mother and child to nearest health facility
When baby passes light-coloured urine at least 6 times a day while being exclusively breastfed
